thread.title: 'The Voice' season 9: Watch all of the battles from Monday's episode
thread.title_full: 'The Voice' season 9: Watch all of the battles from Monday's episode | Examiner.com

author: Brittany Frederick
title: 'The Voice' season 9: Watch all of the battles from Monday's episode
text:
Play Mark Hood vs. Celeste Betton: 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough' NBC/YouTube NBC 's The Voice began its battle rounds on Monday, with six head-to-head matchups between the singing competition's Top 48 artists from season 9. Who stayed, who was stolen by another coach, and who didn't get a second chance and had to head home? If you missed any of the first battles episode, find video of all the duels below:
Team Adam
1. Jordan Smith vs. Regina Love, "Like I Can"
Winner: Jordan Smith
Stolen: Regina Love to Team Gwen
2. James Dupre vs. Dustin Monk, "Fortunate Son"
Winner: James Dupre
Eliminated: Dustin Monk
Team Blake
1. Zach Seabaugh vs. Tyler Dickerson, "I'm Gonna Be Somebody"
Winner: Zach Seabaugh
Eliminated: Tyler Dickerson
2. Barrett Baber vs. Dustin Christensen, "Walking In Memphis"
Winner: Barrett Baber
Stolen: Dustin Christensen to Team Adam
Team Gwen
Ellie Lawrence vs. Tim Atlas, "Sweater Weather"
Winner: Ellie Lawrence
Stolen: Tim Atlas to Team Pharrell
Team Pharrell
Mark Hood vs. Celeste Betton, "Ain't No Mountain High Enough"
Winner: Mark Hood
Eliminated: Celeste Betton
By The Numbers:
Already, The Voice 's coaches have used almost half of their steals. Three steals were issued on Monday out of an eight possible. Adam Levine, Gwen Stefani and Pharrell Williams only have one more free pass remaining, while Blake Shelton was the only coach who did not steal an artist in this first episode; he didn't even attempt to.
Four of the five the artists who turned four chairs in their blind auditions advanced through their battles in this episode - Jordan Smith, James Dupre, Barrett Baber and Mark Hood. Dustin Christensen was the sole loser, but he was stolen by Team Adam, so he advances through to the next round of the competition anyway.
As a result of the steals, only three artists were actually eliminated from the show on Monday - Dustin Monk, Tyler Dickerson, and Celeste Betton. Among those three, only Dustin Monk turned more than one chair in the blind auditions.
The Top 48 is now the Top 45.
The Voice airs Mondays and Tuesdays at 8 p.m ET/PT on NBC.
